result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger A Bates III

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Notice of Alibi
Plaintiff's
Defendant's Motions In Limine
Jury trial - 12 person on February 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on January 30, 2023 at 11:30 am.

11:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Roger A Bates III in court.  Attorney Greg Venturini in court for Roger A Bates III. 
Defendant is requesting a Jury Trial. Court grants and this matter will be set for trial. Bond is continued. Attorney Lambert puts the offer on the record.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: motion and order to withdraw as counsel

11:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Roger A Bates III in court.  Attorney Greg Venturini in court for Roger A Bates III. 
Defendant is requesting adjournment for more time to review discovery.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial on May 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:08 AM Defendant Roger A Bates in court with attorney Greg Venturini.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Jazdzewski is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being a deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. Testifies to being dispatched to a vehicle crash. Testifies to speaking with SAS explaining how the vehicle went into the ditch and the incident that occurred. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to stating she saw the defendant driving the vehicle. Testifies to a K-9 search being done to try and track the defendant. Testifies to the K-9 alerting to illegal substances. Testifies to what was found in the search. Testifies to tests being conducted on the substances. Testifies to the results.
Attorney Venturini cross examines the witness. Testifies to what they used to test the substances. Testifies to being present with the other officer that conducted a substance test. 
Attorney Lambert questions the witness. 

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.
Not guilty pleas are entered.

Bond is continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No controlled substances without a valid prescription.   No contact w/victim or their residence - except parties are allowed contact through telephone and allowed contact for doctor appointments.   Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.

08:50 AM Defendant Roger A Bates in court.  Matthew Steven McElroy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court goes over the defendants status on getting an attorney.
Defendant explains why he would like a bond condition modification.
Attorney McElroy argues against a bond modification.
Victim - SAS makes a statement to the court wanting to modify the no contact condition.
Court leaves the no contact in place but allows the parties to have contact during doctor appointments and telephone contact.
Letter from victim requesting modification of bond condition
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

02:09 PM Defendant Roger A Bates in court.  Nathan T. Oswald appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This matter will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment. Bond is continued.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription.   No contact w/victim or their residence - SAS.   Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.

01:30 PM Defendant Roger A Bates III appears in court, in custody. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. Defendant appears in court by video means.
